author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਅਤਿ ਸੁੰਦਰ ਕੁਲੀਨ ਚਤੁਰ ਮੁਖਿ ਙਿਆਨੀ ਧਨਵੰਤ ॥

translation.text: He may be very handsome, born into a highly respected family, very wise, a famous spiritual teacher, prosperous and wealthy;

transliteration.text: at sundar kulīn chatur mukh niānī dhanavant .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਮਿਰਤਕ ਕਹੀਅਹਿ ਨਾਨਕਾ ਜਿਹ ਪ੍ਰੀਤਿ ਨਹੀ ਭਗਵੰਤ ॥੧॥

translation.text: but even so, he is looked upon as a corpse, O Nanak, if he does not love the Lord God. ||1||

transliteration.text: miratak kahīah nānakā jih prīt nahī bhagavant .1.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

translation.text: He may practice inhaling, exhaling and holding the breath.

translation.text: He may practice spiritual wisdom, meditation, pilgrimages to sacred shrines and ritual cleansing baths.

However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. translation.text: He may cook his own food, and never touch anyone else's; he may live in the wilderness like a hermit.

text: ਰਾਮ ਨਾਮ ਸੰਗਿ ਮਨਿ ਨਹੀ ਹੇਤਾ ॥

translation.text: But if he does not enshrine love for the Lord's Name within his heart,

transliteration.text: rām nām sang man nahī hētā .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective.
